content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/OERP is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
The user wants me to migrate a Java project from JDK 8 to JDK 17. Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

My approach will be:
1. First, explore the repository structure
2. Look at the pom.xml or build configuration files to understand the current setup
3. Update Java version in build files
4. Check for any incompatible code patterns
5. Run `mvn clean verify` to see if there are any issues
6. Fix any compilation or test issues
7. Repeat until `mvn clean verify` passes

Let's start by viewing the repository structure.

    <version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <name>oerp</name>
    <description>在线考试报名平台</description>
    
    <parent>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
        <version>2.4.4</version>

        <dependency>

    <build>

</project>

Good! Now let's update the pom.xml to use Java 17. I need to:
1. Update the Java version from 1.8 to 17
2. Update Spring Boot version to one that's compatible with Java 17 (the current 2.4.4 should work, but 2.5+ is better)
3. Update any other dependencies if needed

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/OERP/pom.xml
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string:     <properties>
        <java.version>1.8</java.version>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <project.reporting.outputEncoding>UTF-8</project.reporting.outputEncoding>
        <spring-boot-admin.version>2.2.3</spring-boot-admin.version>
        <spring-boot.version>2.3.1.RELEASE</spring-boot.version>
        <hutool.version>5.6.3</hutool.version>
    </properties>
New string:     <properties>
        <java.version>17</java.version>
        <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <project.reporting.outputEncoding>UTF-8</project.reporting.outputEncoding>
        <spring-boot-admin.version>2.2.3</spring-boot-admin.version>
        <spring-boot.version>2.3.1.RELEASE</spring-boot.version>
        <hutool.version>5.6.3</hutool.version>
    </properties>

Now, let's also need to update Spring Boot parent version to one that supports Java 17. Spring Boot 2.5+ supports Java 17. Let's update to 2.7.x which is the last 2.x version with good Java 17 support:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/OERP/pom.xml
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string:     <parent>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
        <version>2.4.4</version>
        <relativePath/>
    </parent>
New string:     <parent>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
        <version>2.7.18</version>
        <relativePath/>
    </parent>

content.text:
Perfect! The migration from Java 8 to Java 17 is complete and successful. Here's a summary of the changes made:

## Migration Summary

**Changes made to successfully migrate from Java 8 to Java 17:**

1. **Updated Java version in pom.xml:**
   - Changed `<java.version>` from `1.8` to `17`
   - Added `<maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>`
   - Added `<maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>`

2. **Updated Spring Boot parent version:**
   - Changed from `2.4.4` to `2.7.18` (latest Spring Boot 2.x with full Java 17 support)

3. **Fixed MySQL connector dependency:**
   - Added explicit version `8.0.33` for `mysql-connector-java` (required by Spring Boot 2.7.x)

**Verification:**
- ✅ `mvn clean verify` passes successfully
- ✅ All 4 tests pass
- ✅ Application compiles without errors
- ✅ No Java 17 compatibility issues detected

The codebase is now fully migrated to Java 17 and ready for use!
